plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose known for its ability to bloom repeatedly throughout the warm months. It produces fragrant, colorful flowers that attract pollinators.
plants.location: Native to Southwest China, cultivated worldwide in temperate to subtropical gardens
plants.funFact: China Rose is one of the ancestors of modern hybrid tea roses, prized for its recurrent blooming.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A tall perennial herbaceous plant with dense spikes of pea-like flowers. It thrives in temperate regions and often blooms in early to midsummer.
plants.location: Native to western North America, widely naturalized in Europe and New Zealand
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich soil by fixing nitrogen, aiding in ecological restoration.

plants.name: Nymphaea alba
plants.description: An aquatic plant with large floating leaves and fragrant white flowers that open during the day and close at night.
plants.location: Native across Europe and parts of North Africa and temperate Asia
plants.funFact: Water lilies regulate their temperature to attract pollinators, sometimes heating flowers above ambient temperature.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: A shrub or tree species with dense spikes of yellow-orange flowers, common along the Australian east coast. Flowers provide nectar to many native birds and mammals.
plants.funFact: Banksias are named after botanist Sir Joseph Banks and are key species in Australian ecosystems.
